experiments.name: Parallel-agent debug ledger
experiments.notes: For multi-agent coding, require each agent to append a 3-line 'ledger' (goal / changes / open risks) to a shared file at end of its turn; reviewer agent consumes only ledgers + diff summaries first before diving into full transcripts.

experiments.name: Tool contract snapshot + drift alarm on connect
experiments.notes: On first connect to any tool/server, snapshot tool metadata (name/desc/args), permissions, and egress allowlist; on subsequent connects, diff and require explicit user consent if anything changed (prevents silent tool swaps / poisoning).

experiments.name: Noise-injection regression test
experiments.notes: Add a small nightly eval that runs 5 representative agent tasks under 3 noise profiles (none / user-noise / tool-noise). Track delta-to-baseline; alert if robustness drops >X% even if 'clean' success rate stays flat.

experiments.name: State-diff contracts for your own tools
experiments.notes: For each high-impact tool (filesystem edits, messaging, deployments), define an expected post-state (files changed, message sent, services restarted) and have the agent validate a diff against that contract before finalizing. Log unintended side-effects as harness bugs.

experiments.name: One-tap agent rollback checkpoint
experiments.notes: Before any irreversible tool call (send message / restart / deploy), capture a minimal checkpoint (intended diff + resources touched). If a guardrail trips later, auto-generate a rollback plan referencing that checkpoint (what to undo, in what order).

setupChanges.change: Brave web_search requires ui_lang like en-US (not en).
Some dynamic sites (e.g., W&B reports) may not extract via web_fetch readability; prefer alternate sources or browser snapshot when allowed.
web_fetch readability can truncate long posts; capture the key section early (problem/insight/action) and keep maxChars modest to avoid wasting fetch budget.
Brave web_search Free plan is effectively 1 request per moment; avoid parallel searches or add spacing/retry.
When a source search returns 0 results, use the site landing page + internal links (counts as a fetch, not a search) to stay within query budget.
